frame.name: Natural_features
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Locale</fen> is a geographical location as defined by shape. This frame includes natural geographic features, including land/ice forms and bodies of water.
<ex> We climbed up the <fex name="Constituent_parts">rock</fex> <fex name="Locale"><t>cliff</t></fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Constituent_parts
FE.definition: <def-root>Salient parts of the <fen>Locale</fen>. <ex>We drove through a <fex name="Constituent_parts">mossy</fex> <t>dell</t>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Container_possessor
FE.definition: <def-root>The location that the <fen>Locale</fen> is a part of. <ex>John spent several years wandering the <fex name="Locale"><t>mountains</t></fex> <fex name="Container_possessor">of Romania</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Formational_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>Indicates the action (or causer) which brings the features of the Locale about. <ex> There is a <fex name="Formational_cause">glacial</fex> <fex name="Locale">valley</fex> near here.</ex><ex> There is a <fex name="Formational_cause">impact</fex> <fex name="Locale">valley</fex> near here.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Locale
FE.definition:
<def-root>A stable bounded area. It is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames.
</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root> This FE is used for the <fen>Name</fen>s of <fen>Locale</fen>s. <ex><fex name="Locale"><t>Lake</t></fex> <fex name="Name">Constance</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Name">Pike's</fex> <fex name="Locale"><t>Peak</t></fex></ex> <ex>The <fex name="Name">Indonesian</fex> <fex name="Locale"><t>archipelago</t></fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>A place that a <fen>Locale</fen> is located with respect to.
<ex>All the <fex name="Locale"><t>mountains</t></fex> <fex name="Relative_location">in America</fex> are small.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Type</fen> is the subtype of natural feature. </def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description, characteristic, or property of the <fen>Locale</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs.
<ex>That 's a long way down on such a <fex name="des">steep</fex> <t>cliff</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rill.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a very small stream

lexUnit.name: hill.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a naturally raised area of land, not as high or craggy as a mountain.

lexUnit.name: mountain.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly and to a large height from the surrounding level.

lexUnit.name: knoll.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small hill or mound.

lexUnit.name: cordillera.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a system or group of parallel mountain ranges together with the intervening plateaux and other features, especially in the Andes or the Rocky Mountains.

lexUnit.name: lake.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large area of water surrounded by land.

lexUnit.name: pond.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fairly small body of still water

lexUnit.name: tarn.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small mountain lake

lexUnit.name: creek.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow, sheltered waterway such as an inlet in a shoreline or channel in a marsh, or a stream or minor tributary of a river.

lexUnit.name: vale.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a valley (poetic/literary, unless part of a place name)

lexUnit.name: crevasse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a deep open crack in a glacier or ice field.

lexUnit.name: sound.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow stretch of water forming an inlet or connecting two larger bodies of water.

lexUnit.name: strait.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow passage of water connecting two seas or other large areas of water

lexUnit.name: valley.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low area between hills or mountains, typically with a river or stream flowing through it.

lexUnit.name: river.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large natural flow of water travelling along a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river.

lexUnit.name: sea.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the expanse of salt water that covers most of the earth's surface and surrounds its land masses.

lexUnit.name: ocean.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a very large expanse of sea; in particular, each of the Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, Arctic, and Antarctic Oceans.

lexUnit.name: pool.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small area of still water, typically one formed naturally.

lexUnit.name: peninsula.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, narrow piece of land projecting out into a sea or lake

lexUnit.name: fjord.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, narrow, deep inlet of the sea between high cliffs, typically formed by submergence of a glaciated valley and found predominantly in Norway.

lexUnit.name: outcrop.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rock formation that is visible on the surface.

lexUnit.name: island.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of land surrounded by water

lexUnit.name: archipelago.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an extensive group of islands.

lexUnit.name: crag.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a steep or rugged cliff or rock face.

lexUnit.name: glacier.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a slowly moving mass of ice formed by the accumulation and compaction of snow on mountains or near the poles.

lexUnit.name: canyon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a deep gorge, especially one with a river flowing through it.

lexUnit.name: mount.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: archaic or in place names a mountain or hill: Mount Everest.

lexUnit.name: cove.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small sheltered bay.

lexUnit.name: bay.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a broad curved inlet of the sea.

lexUnit.name: inlet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small arm of the sea, a lake, or a river.

lexUnit.name: cliff.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a steep rock face, especially at the edge of the sea.

lexUnit.name: channel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a length of water wider than a strait, joining two larger areas of water, especially two seas.

lexUnit.name: headland.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow piece of land projecting into the sea.

lexUnit.name: isthmus.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow strip of land with sea on either side, linking two larger areas of land

lexUnit.name: cave.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large natural underground chamber.

lexUnit.name: cavern.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large cave, or chamber in a cave.

lexUnit.name: iceberg.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large mass of ice floating in the sea.

lexUnit.name: berg.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: short for iceberg.

lexUnit.name: waterfall.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cascade of water falling from a height, formed when a river or stream flows over a precipice or steep incline

lexUnit.name: falls.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a waterfall or cascade.

lexUnit.name: spring.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a place where water wells up from an underground source.

lexUnit.name: cataract.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large waterfall.

lexUnit.name: stream.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small, narrow river

lexUnit.name: brook.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small stream.

lexUnit.name: atoll.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a ring-shaped reef or chain of islands formed of coral.

lexUnit.name: floe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sheet of floating ice.

lexUnit.name: dune.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mound or ridge of sand or other loose sediment formed by the wind, especially on the sea coast or in a desert.

lexUnit.name: massif.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a compact group of mountains.

lexUnit.name: loch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a lake.

lexUnit.name: butte.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an isolated hill with steep sides and a flat top.

lexUnit.name: fell.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hill or stretch of high moorland, especially in northern England.

lexUnit.name: hillock.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small hill or mound.

lexUnit.name: mesa.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an isolated flat-topped hill with steep sides, found in landscapes with horizontal strata.

lexUnit.name: isle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an island.

lexUnit.name: islet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small island.

lexUnit.name: cay.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low bank or reef of coral, rock, or sand.

lexUnit.name: sandbar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, narrow sandbank

lexUnit.name: coombe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short valley or hollow on a hillside or coastline, especially in southern England.

lexUnit.name: key.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low-lying island or reef (especially in the Caribbean)

lexUnit.name: crater.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large bowl-shaped cavity, especially one caused by an explosion or impact or forming the mouth of a volcano.

lexUnit.name: bar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sandbank or shoal at the mouth of a harbour or an estuary.

lexUnit.name: sandbank.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a deposit of sand forming a shallow area in a sea or a river

lexUnit.name: sandspit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low ridge of sand that projects into a body of water.

lexUnit.name: reef.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a ridge of jagged rock, coral, or sand just above or below the surface of the sea.

lexUnit.name: clough.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a steep valley or ravine.

lexUnit.name: dale.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a valley, especially in northern England.

lexUnit.name: defile.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a steep-sided narrow gorge or passage

lexUnit.name: dell.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small valley.

lexUnit.name: depression.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sunken place or hollow.

lexUnit.name: range.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a line or series of mountains or hills

lexUnit.name: dingle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a deep wooded valley.

lexUnit.name: gap.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a mountain pass

lexUnit.name: pass.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a route over or through mountains.

lexUnit.name: glen.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow valley, especially in Scotland or Ireland.

lexUnit.name: graben.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an elongated block of the earth's crust lying between two faults and displaced downwards, as in a rift valley.

lexUnit.name: gulch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow, steep-sided ravine marking the course of a fast stream.

lexUnit.name: gully.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a water-worn ravine.

lexUnit.name: hollow.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small valley.

lexUnit.name: ravine.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a deep, narrow gorge with steep sides, usually worn by running water

lexUnit.name: beck.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a stream.

lexUnit.name: hummock.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hillock or knoll, or a hump or ridge in an ice field, or a piece of forested ground rising above a marsh.

lexUnit.name: moraine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mass of rocks and sediment carried down and deposited by a glacier.

lexUnit.name: burn.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small stream. (Scottish English)

lexUnit.name: shelf.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a ledge of rock or protruding strip of land or a submarine bank, or a part of the continental shelf.

lexUnit.name: shoal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area of shallow water or a submerged sandbank visible at low water.

lexUnit.name: lagoon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a stretch of salt water separated from the sea by a low sandbank or coral reef, or a small freshwater lake near a larger lake or river.

lexUnit.name: slough.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a low, muddy area.

lexUnit.name: bayou.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (in the southern US) a marshy outlet of a lake or river.

lexUnit.name: tor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hill or rocky peak

lexUnit.name: eyot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small island in a river.

lexUnit.name: plateau.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a usually extensive area of fairly level, high ground

lexUnit.name: seamount.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a submarine mountain rising from the sea floor

lexUnit.name: guyot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a seamount with a flat top.

lexUnit.name: volcano.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mountain or hill having a crater or vent through which lava, rock fragments, hot vapour, and gas are or have been erupted from the earth's crust.

lexUnit.name: declivity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a downward slope.

lexUnit.name: corrie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cirque, especially one in the mountains of Scotland.

lexUnit.name: ridge.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long narrow hilltop, mountain range, or watershed

lexUnit.name: skerry.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a reef or rocky island

lexUnit.name: rapids.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a part of a river where the current is fast and the surface is often broken by obstructions

lexUnit.name: watershed.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area or ridge of land that separates waters flowing to different rivers, basins, or seas.

lexUnit.name: height.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a rise of ground, such as a hill or mountain

lexUnit.name: cirque.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a steep-sided hollow at the head of a valley or on a mountainside.

lexUnit.name: beach.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pebbly or sandy shore at the edge of the sea or a lake. NB: this is actually a radial category, with "sandy shore of a sea" as the center, and either the sandy or the sea contradictable. In addition, a beach is required to be fairly flat.

lexUnit.name: continent.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: any of the world's main continuous expanses of land (Europe, Asia, Africa, North and South America, Australia, Antarctica).

lexUnit.name: continental.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: forming or belonging to a continent.

lexUnit.name: peak.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the pointed top of a mountain.

lexUnit.name: coastal.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: pertaining to the coast

lexUnit.name: wash.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small river or stream that usually carries water only after rain.

lexUnit.name: strand.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the shore of a sea, lake, or large river.

lexUnit.name: rugged.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having a rocky and uneven surface.

lexUnit.name: gulf.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a very large area of ocean that is partially bordered by land.

lexUnit.name: cascade.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a waterfall or succession of waterfalls

lexUnit.name: land.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a broad piece of solid ground (in opposition to a large mass of water, i.e. a sea or ocean)

lexUnit.name: water.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a mass of water

lexUnit.name: range [grazing].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: land that produces plants for grazing of livestock
